entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 100 to 150 mm of rain. Peak rates of 25 to 40 mm/h Saturday when thunderstorms could bring localised downpours. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h after midnight on Saturday. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Watch upgraded to an Orange Warning.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 70 to 100 mm of rain. Peak rates generally 15 to 25 mm/h. Note that thunderstorms may bring localised downpours north of Napier with rainfall rates of 25 to 40 mm/h. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Watch upgraded to an Orange Warning.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary: Afternoon and early evening heating and wind convergence bring a moderate risk of thunderstorms to Northland and Auckland, as well as an associated moderate risk of LOCALISED DOWNPOURS of 25 to 40 mm/h. Rainfall of this intensity can cause surface and/or flash flooding, especially about low-lying areas such as streams, rivers or narrow valleys, and may also lead to slips.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning
entry.summary:
At 05:15 pm, MetService weather radar detected severe thunderstorms near AUCKLAND, KUMEU, ALBANY, HENDERSON and HUAPAI.
These severe thunderstorms are moving towards the southsoutheast, and are expected to lie near AUCKLAND, HENDERSON and MANUKAU HEADS at 05:45 pm and near AUCKLAND, MANUKAU HEADS, CLARKS BEACH, AWHITU and AUCKLAND AIRPORT at 06:15 pm.
These thunderstorms are expected to be accompanied by torrential rain.
Impact:
Torrential rain can cause surface and/or flash flooding about streams, gullies and urban areas, and make driving conditions extremely hazardous.
